snippet: Azithromycin, a popular drug, can cause changes in the electrical activity of the heart that may lead to a fatal irregular heart rhythm in some patients.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration toughens its warning about potential risks of popular antibiotic Azithromycin, saying it can cause changes in heart's electrical activity that may lead to fatal irregular heart rhythm in some patients.
lead_paragraph: Azithromycin, a popular drug, can cause changes in the electrical activity of the heart that may lead to a fatal irregular heart rhythm in some patients.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Toughens Heart Warning on a Common Antibiotic
headline.main: F.D.A. Raises Heart Alert on Antibiotic in Wide Use
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Raises Heart Alert On Antibiotic In Wide Use
